entry.title: Re: About scope items for material closing period(MMPV)
entry.content:
Hello @ki2003 ,

As @FernandaKlauck explained in his post,

The Material Closing Period (MMPV) function was never moved to 3F0; it remains accessible via the Close Periods (F2540) app under Master Data – Administration. The 3F0 scope covers event-based costing, with material period close continuing separately.

This page describes how users open or close posting periods for logistics areas like Materials Management. This functionality, formerly managed through transaction MMPV, is now integrated into the SAP Fiori app instead of the 3F0 (Event-Based Costing) scope. SAP Help-General Ledger Accounting-Opening and Closing Posting Periods

BEI → 3F0: BEI Period-End Closing – Plant deprecated as of 2408, decommissioned in 2602; costing moves to 3F0 Event-Based Production Cost Posting KBA -3599914 - About the transition from the scope item BEI to the scope item 3F0

Why 3F0 test scripts don’t show MMPV: 3F0 handles event-based production cost posting. The material posting period closes the classic “MMPV” function, which is separate from logistics control. SAP Help Portal-Product Accounting-Event-Based (3F0) versus Period-Based (BEI) in Production Costs of Manufacturing Orders

MMPV's current location: Use the Close Periods feature in S/4HANA Cloud (Fiori) via Master Data → Administration to open or close MM posting periods. SAP’s help documentation and SAP blog provide the title and navigation path.  SAP Help Portal-Create New Open MM Posting Period - MDS (BNZ)-Closing MM Period and Opening New Posting Period

Authorisations to run Close Periods: If users cannot see or run it, check authorisations. KBA 2748224 documents the Close Periods app error “No authorization to carry out period closing” and mentions the relevant business roles/catalogues.

In brief

  • MMPV wasn’t moved into 3F0, so you won’t find it in 3F0 test scripts.
  • Continue to close MM periods via Close Periods (Fiori) under Master Data → Administration; ensure proper authorisation as per KBA 2748224.
  • The BEI → 3F0 change affects production costing, not the existence of the Close Periods activity.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Mass maintenance catalog for business partners
entry.content:
Hi @JackN11 

Here is a step-by-step process you can follow:

Either you use the Mass Change of Business Partners app or use the Maintain Business Roles app (this is what i use for the description here) which you can find in your IAM tile.

Go to:

  1. Maintain Business Roles app, search for the role SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST or SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_DATA_SUPERVISOR
  2. Copy the role to your Z-role or you can edit your existing custom role.
  3. In the role, assign Assigned Business Catalogs and add: SAP_CMD_BC_BUSINESS_PARTNER_PC  (this is the successor to the old mass-maintenance catalog)
  4. Save the role.

Still in IAM, open Maintain Business Users, find your user, then edit, assign business roles, add the Z-role mentioned earlier and save. Then log out and in again.

Here is how you can identify successor catalogs next time you may require it

Open Business Cataltogs or Maintain Business Roles.

Search the app Mass change of Business Partners à open the app info pane à it shows the current catalog that delivers it (here: SAP_CMD_BC_BUSINES_ PARTNER_MAINT_PC)

If your app still doesn’t appear, ensure your role includes mentioned earlier and that you have re-logged in. If you space doesn’t show the tile; use the search function to add it to My Home. Keep your catalogs in custom roles (Z) so future upgrades don’t overwrite your changes.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: OnSave Business Rule for dependents
entry.content:
Hi All,

I would like to ask you the question regarding the onSave business rule used for the validation of the date of birth for the dependents. My client asked to enable the validation that if the DOB of a new joiner in onboarding is on or before the DOB of a dependent set to father or mother, then the error message should display.

I achieved this with the simple business rule assigned to personRelationshipInfo as onSave. The rule works when the condition is met, it even works when the data is corrected (i.e. DOB is corrected, relationship type is changed from father/mother to something else) - and this is where the issue occurs. With that the onboarding process will get stacked. I tried to modify the rule by following the suggestion from this KBA, but I am unable to use previous value since Employee Information as the base object. Using Employee Information Model causes that the rule does not work (the error does not trigger); same happens when I use dependents model.

What I tried as the alternative is to create the onChange rule which would remove the DOB of a dependent. I managed to trigger this rule, but only when the relationship type is changed (which is not ideal, because a new joiner will not be changing the relationship type in this case, rather the DOB). The problem is the rule removes only the current value, and not the old value, hence the error still displays when you reach the end of the data collection step.

Alternatively I changed the severity of the message to warning, but the warning will still display even after correcting the data, which will not block the onb process, but will be confusing for the end user.

Does anyone knows how to workaround this? I spent way too much time on this and could not find the solution.

I attached the screen shots of both rules for your reference.

Regards,

Piotr Retecki

entry.title: Re: remove the payment advice number from Feban
entry.content:
Hi Misha,
Refer to your issue to remove or restrict the payment advice number in SAP FEBAN, you need to adjust the Electronic Bank Statement (EBS) configuration and possibly suppress payment advice creation during post-processing. You can follow the approach to address this issue. Please fine the steps to remove or restrict Payment Advice Number in FEBAN

1. Review Posting Rules in FF_5 Configuration.
Go to transaction OT83 or OT84 depending on your system version.
Check the posting rules assigned to your bank transaction codes.
Ensure that the rule does not trigger payment advice creation unless necessary.

2. Suppress Payment Advice Creation
In the EBS configuration, set the posting area 2 to avoid generating payment advice notes.
You can also modify the interpretation algorithm to prevent linking payment advice numbers to line items.

3. Use User Exit or BADI
Implement a user exit or BADI (e.g., FEB_BADI) to control or suppress the payment advice number dynamically during FEBAN processing.
This allows you to apply custom logic based on document type, amount, or other criteria.

4. Manual Removal in FEBAN
If the advice number is already present, you can manually clear or adjust the entry in FEBAN:
Open FEBAN.
Select the line item.
Use the “Change” option to remove the payment advice reference.
Reprocess the item to ensure proper posting.

5. Prevent Double Posting
Ensure that the payment advice number is not reused across multiple transactions.
You may need to adjust your clearing settings or duplicate check logic in SAP to prevent this.

Hope the above suggestion helped you.

entry.title: Re: Created Custom Business Object in SAP Public Cloud In...
entry.content:
Hi @shivakumar_p 

The fact you don’t have Form Template Usage option your Custom CDS View, this hints that it was not built on a released data source and service generation was probably not enabled.

Since your CDS is based on a Custom Business Object, make sure you have:

  • Opened your CBO, activated Service Generation and UI Generation.
  • Published the CBO
  • Created a CDS View using the CBO as primary data source.
  • You will then see the checkbox Form Template Usage; ensure you select and publish it.
  • The CDS now appears in Maintain Form Templates as a valid data source.

Without you enabling service, the system cannot expose the CBO to the form framework. This explains why you can’t see the Form Template option.

After you have enabled it, you can link the form to your custom button through custom logic that calls the form service API to download or print the report.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Issue with CJ88: "Either the sender is already settle...
entry.content:
Dear Mohideen Sait,
Yes, you can implement a short delay in your macro is the most reliable solution to ensure CJ88 executes successfully after FB01 posting.

I have few more suggestions for you. Please find them below.

1. Add a Delay in the Macro
Introduce a wait time of 5–10 seconds between FB01 and CJ88 execution.
This allows SAP to complete internal updates and ensures the settlement finds the posted values.
You can use a WAIT statement or a timer function depending on your macro environment.

2. Use Commit Work and Wait (if scripting in ABAP)
If your macro interacts with ABAP or BAPI calls, ensure COMMIT WORK AND WAIT is used after FB01.
This forces SAP to complete all updates before proceeding.

3. Check for Posting Confirmation
If feasible, add a check to confirm that the document posted in FB01 is visible in the relevant tables (e.g., COEP or COBK) before triggering CJ88.

4. Batch Job Alternative
If automation is critical, consider scheduling CJ88 as a background job with a slight delay after FB01 posting.


Hope above suggestions work for you.

entry.title: Unlock the Power of Analytics with the New SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook
entry.content:
Are you ready to take your sales and service operations to the next level? The brand-new SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook – Analytics is here to help you unlock the full potential of embedded analytics in your SAP environment. 

 

Why Analytics Matter More Than Ever 

In today’s fast-paced business world, having real-time insights is not just a luxury—it’s a necessity. The playbook shows how Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) empowers both end users and key users to build, consume, and act on analytical content directly within SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2. With role-based dashboards, KPIs, and real-time reporting, you can make smarter decisions, faster. 

 

What’s Inside the Playbook? 

  • Clear Value Propositions: Learn how analytics save time, improve efficiency, and keep your teams on target. No more manual data crunching—get critical information at your fingertips. 
  • Step-by-Step Adoption Guidance: Identify opportunities for analytics adoption across sales managers, reps, service managers, and administrators. The playbook helps you assess your current visibility and highlights where analytics can drive the most impact. 
  • Lead-to-Cash Journey Mapping: See how analytics support every stage of the customer journey—from lead qualification and opportunity conversion to order delivery and post-sale follow-up. 
  • Business KPIs That Matter: Discover the key metrics that drive sales and service success, including pipeline management, lead conversion rates, SLA compliance, and agent performance. 
  • Best Practices and Real Results: Explore real-world examples and best practices that have delivered measurable business outcomes, such as faster opportunity identification, improved data quality, and optimized service team performance. 
  • Getting Started Made Easy: The playbook provides practical setup instructions for provisioning SAC, configuring single sign-on, managing user replication, and designing analytical stories tailored to your business roles. 

 

See Analytics in Action 

The playbook is packed with visuals and examples, including: 

  • Home screen KPI dashboards for sales reps 
  • Lead funnel and pipeline insights 
  • Forecast trackers and pipeline flow diagrams 
  • Service case overviews and escalation metrics 
  • Agent performance dashboards and SLA compliance tracking 

Resources at Your Fingertips 

Ready to dive deeper? The playbook links to solution guides, webcasts, blogs, and video tutorials to help you get started and maximize your analytics investment. 

Don’t miss out on the opportunity to transform your sales and service operations. Download the new SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook – Analytics today and empower your teams with the insights they need to succeed! 

Find the download link of the SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook here: SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 - Analytics Playbook

entry.title: SIT Berlin Website Live Now With All Session Recordings
entry.content:
SAP Inside Tracks are still are for me personally still one of the best things that came out of the SAP community, bringing so many people together all around the world. I did my part with the organization of SAP Inside Track Berlin during the years from 2017 to 2019, one of my personal highlights being part of SAP and its amazing community.

And now finally after all these years, SAP Inside Track Berlin has its very own website: https://sitberlin.net

For everyone who has been part of the Berlin SIT community (and for those who’ve always wanted to join), this is the new home where all the great content from our events comes together. Every single session from SIT Berlin has been recorded and is available on the website. Whether you missed a talk or just want to revisit one of your favorites, you can find it there. Much of the content is evergreen like the 101 of Machine Learning aka AI, Design Thinking practices, and other topics that are still worth watching today (some things change very slowly in the SAP ecosystem).

I also made available all the photos we took during the events, hopefully giving you some better insight of the event. And for the people that attended any of the events, they hopefully bring back good memories 🙂

Of course the site has been vibe-coded and it was a lot of fun and not much effort to create something that truly reflects the spirit of our local community: open, creative, and full of good energy. The website code is available on Github, just in case anybody is eager to have a look. also feel free to open to provide feedback vie Github issues.

Visit OpenSIT for more SIT content

If you want to explore even more SAP Inside Track recordings from around the world, head over to OpenSIT where I aggregated the recorded sessions from many other SAP Inside Tracks.

See you at SAP TechEd Berlin

And while I'm not with SAP anymore, I’m already looking forward to seeing many of my friends (and meeting some new ones) at SAP TechEd in November in Berlin. Until then, have fun exploring the new site and revisiting all the great moments from SIT Berlin.

entry.title: Find Your Path to SAP Cloud ERP: Introducing the Transformation Approach Finder
entry.content:
As organizations prepare to transition from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP, one question consistently arises: Which transformation path is right for us? At SAP, we understand that every customer journey is unique. That’s why we’re excited to introduce a new feature in SAP Business Transformation Center—the “Find Transformation Approach” app, now available in SAP Cloud ALM.

This innovative guidance tool helps customers identify the most suitable transition path based on their current landscape, business goals, and transformation readiness.

Three Proven Paths to SAP Cloud ERP

The transformation journey from ECC to SAP Cloud ERP typically follows one of three approaches. Let’s explore each, along with the tools SAP provides to support them:

1. System Conversion

Best for: Customers who want to retain their existing ECC system structure and migrate it to SAP S/4HANA.

  • Tool: Software Update Manager (SUM)
  • Highlights: Technical conversion of an existing system, preserving historical data and configuration.

 

 

2. Selective Data Transition

Best for: Customers who want to move only relevant data including history selectively into an empty SAP S/4HANA shell system.

  • Tool: SAP Business Transformation Center
  • Scenario: Lean Selective Data Transition
  • Highlights: Combines the benefits of system conversion and new implementation. Enables process redesign and selective data migration.

 

3. New Implementation

Best for: Customers aiming for a fresh start with SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP.

  • Tool: SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit
  • Highlights: Clean slate approach with data migration from legacy systems into a new cloud environment.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

How the “Find Transformation Approach” App Works

The “Find Transformation Approach” app in SAP Business Transformation Center is designed to guide customers through the decision-making process for transitioning from SAP ECC to SAP Cloud ERP. It does not replace expert-led discovery workshops but complements them by providing a structured, data-driven starting point.

Step 1: System Analysis

Before any assessments are made, the app leverages two key SAP tools to analyze the source system:

  • Maintenance Readiness Check: This check collects technical information from the source SAP ECC system:
    📑SAP Note 3620764: Execute Maintenance Readiness Check (MRC) on local system and store result as file

  • SAP Readiness Check for Usage and Data Profiling: This provides application-level insights into business process usage, data volumes, and complexity.
    📑SAP Note 3275056 : SAP Readiness Check for SAP ERP Usage and Data Profiling

Those can be uploaded using the app "Manage Analysis Files" also part of SAP Business Transformation Center.

Step 2: System Insights

The Initial System Insights screen provides a high-level overview of the source SAP ECC system, based on data collected through the Maintenance Readiness Check and SAP Readiness Check for Usage and Data Profiling.

These insights include:

  • Technical System Information
    Derived from the Maintenance Readiness Check, this includes:

    • System version and patch level
    • Installed components and add-ons
    • Custom code footprint
    • Database and operating system details

  • Application Usage and Data Profiling
    Provided by the SAP Readiness Check, this includes:

    • Most-used transactions and modules
    • Data volumes by application area
    • Archiving status and data aging
    • Business process complexity

These insights form the foundation for the preliminary transformation assessment, helping customers understand their system’s readiness and complexity before diving into the detailed questionnaire.

 

Step 3: Preliminary Assessment

Based on the collected system data, the app generates an initial preliminary assessment suggesting the most suitable transformation approach—System Conversion, Selective Data Transition, or New Implementation.

Customers can review and verify the preliminary assessment and proceed to a detailed questionnaire. This step allows refinement based on business priorities, transformation goals, and organizational readiness.

 

Step 4: Verification and Refinement

After reviewing the preliminary assessment, users are invited to complete a structured questionnaire to refine the transformation approach recommendation. This step is crucial for tailoring the guidance to the organization’s specific transformation context.

The questionnaire covers several dimensions:

  • Business Priorities

    • Are you aiming for process standardization or innovation?
    • Do you want to retain historical data or start fresh?
    • Is cloud adoption a strategic goal?

  • Transformation Drivers

    • Regulatory or compliance requirements
    • End-of-maintenance timelines
    • Performance or scalability needs

  • IT Landscape Considerations

    • Number of ECC systems and their interdependencies
    • Custom developments and enhancements
    • Integration with non-SAP systems

  • Organizational Readiness

    • Availability of internal resources
    • Experience with previous transformation projects
    • Appetite for change and innovation

Each response helps refine the initial system-based assessment, ensuring that the final recommendation reflects both technical realities and strategic ambitions.

 

Step 5: Final Output

Once the questionnaire is completed, the app presents the best-fit transformation scenario, along with links to relevant tools, documentation, and next steps to support execution.

 

Step 6: Scenario Selection 

Independent from the assessment result, the user can choose a transformation scenario, in this case even though system conversion has the highest scoring, user has chosen the selective data transition scenario:

 

Step 7: Transformation Project Creation 

Once you've identified the best-fit transformation scenario using the Find Transformation Approach app, the next step is to put your plan into motion—and SAP makes that seamless.

Thanks to full integration with the transformation project capabilities in SAP Business Transformation Center, users can immediately create a transformation project tailored to the selected scenario. This ensures continuity between planning and execution, with no need to switch tools or re-enter data.

You can launch the Manage Transformation Project app directly from within the Find Transformation Approach app, or access it anytime via the Transformation tab in SAP Cloud ALM.

Whether you're pursuing a System Conversion, Selective Data Transition, or New Implementation, your transformation project becomes the central hub for managing the journey from ECC to SAP Cloud ERP.

Find out more details about the "Manage Transformation Project" capabilities in the respective blog post.

Important Note

The Find Transformation Approach app is a guidance tool, not a prescriptive engine. It supports informed decision-making but does not replace expert-led discovery workshops or transformation planning sessions. It is best used in addition to these engagements to accelerate alignment and readiness.

Why SAP Business Transformation Center?

SAP Business Transformation Center is more than a migration tool—it’s a strategic enabler. It helps customers:

  • Visualize their current ECC landscape
  • Plan transformation scenarios
  • Execute lean selective data transitions
  • Align IT and business stakeholders

With the new guidance feature, customers can confidently navigate their journey to SAP Cloud ERP.

Get Started Today

Explore the Find Transformation Approach app in SAP Business Transformation Center powered by SAP Cloud ALM and take the first step toward a smarter, faster, and more tailored ERP transformation.

Learn more on SAP Help Portal here

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Missing standard value in a c...
entry.content:
Hello @LukasKuhn 

Yes, this is possible. The default setting for Calculate Tax is determined by the business catalogue SAP_MM_BC_INV_PROCESS_PC (Accounts Payable – Invoice Processing).

Add this catalogue or any standard role that contains it,such as SAP_BR_AP_ACCOUNTANT or SAP_BR_AP_ACCOUNTANT_PROCUREMT) to the user’s role, then log off/on.
After that, the Calculate Tax field will appear in Settings → Default Values.

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Problem with alternative valuation rund CKMLCPAVR
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Initial situation:
Existing ECC 6.0 EHP 8
New general ledger accounting active (4 ledgers in use)
Material ledger active
Alternative valuation run CKMLCPAVR with delta posting logic for company in Turkey

Problem:
We are in the process of converting from ECC to S/4 2023 FP3. This changes the data structures with regard to the material ledger and also the posting logic of the ML runs CKMLCP and CKMLCPAVR.
For our plant in Turkey, we first execute CKMLCP and then CKMLCPAVR for ledger L1 in ECC. The aim is to use this to perform the legal valuation of inventories with different rates.
This procedure is no longer possible with S/4. CKMLCPAVR can no longer be executed if a regular CKMLCP has already been executed.

SAP now points out that for this constellation, the parallel valuation of production costs and the regular, parallel valuation must still be introduced within ECC, as subsequent introduction for active company codes in S/4 is no longer possible.

Are there companies here with a similar problem and experience with a solution without parallel valuation?

Thanks in advance

Marco

entry.title: Second Half 2025 Release: What's new in SAP SuccessFactors solutions for Workforce Management
entry.content:
Time keeps moving, and so does innovation in SAP SuccessFactors solutions. The second half 2025 release delivers a powerful set of enhancements designed to simplify how organizations track, manage, and schedule time. In this blog, I’ll cover the key highlights across SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking, Employee Central, and the newly introduced SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling solution. For a full overview, be sure to check out the ‘What’s New Viewer’.

Before diving into the details, there’s a major milestone worth celebrating: the introduction of SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling, expanding SAP’s capabilities into intelligent, demand-driven shift planning. Combined with new advancements in time tracking accuracy, compliance, and leave management, these updates continue to help organizations streamline processes, empower employees, and align workforce planning with business goals.

This evolution also signals our transition from “Time Management” to the broader category of “Workforce Management.” At SAP SuccessFactors, we are committed to empowering organizations with a complete and connected approach to workforce management. Our solutions have long supported global absence management and comprehensive time tracking, helping hourly, shift-based, and deskless employees stay productive and compliant across industries and geographies. With customers in 195 countries and across more than 29 industries, we bring a truly global perspective to how work gets done. Now, with the introduction of SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling, we are taking workforce management to the next level.

Enhancing compliance, accuracy, and transparency

This release brings several key updates that enhance compliance, improve audit readiness, and simplify time tracking for employees and administrators.

With the new geofencing feature in time tracking, employees can now clock in and out only when physically present at their designated work location. Geofences can be defined for specific groups, providing real-time visibility into proximity to authorized areas. This capability helps enforce location-based policies, ensuring accurate and compliant time recording across distributed teams.

Geofencing

Employees can now also generate a time sheet change audit report directly from the time sheet interface. This allows both employees and managers to review any edits or updates made to a time sheet, improving transparency and ensuring data accuracy during audits or investigations.

Time sheet change audit report

Advancing absence and leave management

The second half 2025 release also delivers meaningful updates to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Time Management, helping organizations stay compliant with country-specific regulations and automate complex leave processes.

With the new Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) enhancement, organizations in the United States (US) can now seamlessly connect with FMLA service providers to automate leave deductions and inbound data sharing such as case IDs and dates. This ensures greater accuracy in leave tracking and reduces manual administrative effort.

Family and Medical Leave Act

In addition, employees in Australia can now accrue and deduct leave in full-week units, aligning with local labor regulations and simplifying compliance management for HR teams.

Leave in full-week units

To further streamline payroll processes, a new automated payout capability enables time account balances to be paid out automatically at the end of a pay period once defined thresholds are reached. This enhancement supports multiple pay components, ensuring timely and accurate employee payments. Read more here: Payout with Flexible Pay Components using Periodic Updates – 2H 2025

Introducing SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling

This release marks the debut of SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling, designed for manufacturing and production industries. The solution will be available for early adopters in December 2025 and is planned for general availability later in 2026.

The solution supports demand-driven workforce planning, allowing organizations to create weekly or monthly shift plans that align with operational requirements and employee skills. By optimizing scheduling and providing real-time visibility into workforce availability, organizations can minimize downtime, improve productivity, and better align labor supply with business demand.

To learn more, watch the virtual session from Success Connect at SAP Connect - Smarter scheduling: Inside SAP’s new innovation in workforce management

SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling

You can explore all the new enhancements for SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking and Employee Central Time Management in the 'What’s New Viewer.' Information about SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling will be available at launch in December 2025.

For additional release information and assets, visit the SAP SuccessFactors community page.

entry.title: Re: Streamline Data Migration from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA: Selective Data Transition with Time-Slice
entry.content:
Hello @Necronomicon 

There are no restrictions on usage of SAP BTC related to the database size of the source system. Source system size will impact the runtime of the migration. But this also heavily depends on the system resources and source database performance. In order to provide a recommendation, all these parameters have to be checked and validated against the expected downtime window of the customer. We see projects where a proper DB parameterization which is then setup temporarily for the data migration load only leads to significant runtime increases.  We would recommend to explore the available options to reduce the target system size by applying org and/or time slice patterns. For a running customer project, we have a reduction from 2.6TB to approx. 600GB on the target side with org and time slice applied. The customer as well runs on Oracle on the source side.

There is no SAP note that specifies the concrete system configuration. You can refer to the section "Tuning the Data Transfer" in the Setup and Administration Guide. Based on feedback received we are currently revisiting the documentation and extending the guidance also based on source db. 

If you have a concrete customer project, running a PoC would also be a good option to verify the approach and check the runtime/duration. Once a tenant is available and if there should be any issues occur, you can also contact "us" the product team via a ticket as well. 

 

Thanks,

Matthias

entry.title: SAPで実現するサブスクリプション管理#4―AIエージェントとデータ基盤が実現する次世代のサブスクリプション管理
entry.content:
本ブログシリーズをご覧いただき、ありがとうございます。これまでの3回にわたり、サブスクリプションビジネスへの移行と、その成功の鍵となるQ2C（Quote-to-Cash）ソリューションの重要性について解説してきました。

  • 第一回：SAPで実現するサブスクリプション管理#1―あらゆる業界で進む「所有から利用」への大転換 - SAP Community
  • 第二回：SAPで実現するサブスクリプション管理#2ーサブスクリプションビジネス成功の鍵：Q2Cソリューション... - SAP Community
  • 第三回：SAPで実現するサブスクリプション管理#3—企業事例で学ぶ：Q2Cソリューションがサブスク成長を加速... - SAP Community

最終回となる今回は、SAPがQ2C領域、特にサブスクリプション管理において、AIエージェントとデータ基盤を軸にどのような戦略を描き、未来のビジネスをどのように変革しようとしているのか、その全体像をご紹介します。

1. SAPが推進するビジネスAI戦略
SAPが推進する「ビジネスAI」戦略は、アプリケーション・データ基盤・AIの三層構造で構成されています。これらの層が緊密に連携することで、AIは実際のビジネスコンテキストを理解し、自律的に業務を遂行できるようになります。 まず、SAPの各種アプリケーションで発生するビジネスデータを、SAP Business Data Cloud（BDC）が一元的に管理します。BDCは、アプリケーションで生成される膨大なデータを整備・統合し、AIエージェントが高精度に動作するための信頼性の高い基盤を提供します。 すなわち、アプリケーションとBDCが連携することによって初めて、AIエージェントは“動く”ことができるのです。これがSAPの「ビジネスAI」戦略の根幹をなす考え方です。

AI戦略、BDCの詳細については、以下の公式ブログもご参照ください： 👉 SAP Business Data Cloud の概要

2. Q2Cプロセスを変革する「AIエージェント」の未来像
SAPが開発を進めるAIエージェント（Joule）は、「人間のように自律的に業務を遂行するAI」です。将来的には、会計や販売管理などの分野ごとに特化した複数のAIエージェントが登場し、人間が協働するようにAI同士が連携して業務プロセスを最適化する世界を目指しています。
Q2C領域においても、このAIエージェントの登場は大きな変革をもたらします。 Q2Cプロセス全体――案件管理から見積、オーダー登録、請求処理、入金確認、そして継続的な改善に至るまで――において、AIが業務を支援し、最適化を自動で行います。たとえば次のような活用が想定されます。

  • 見積・オーダー段階：非構造化データからの見積作成、受注登録の自動化、ソリューションオーダーの問題解決支援、返品対応の自動化
  • 請求段階：料金計算エラーの自動検出と修正
  • 入金段階：入金データと請求書のマッチング自動化
  • 改善段階：受注状況の分析、価格やバンドル構成の最適化、エンタイトルメント（利用権）の最適管理

これらのAI機能は、アプリケーションが処理する信頼性の高いビジネスデータを基盤として動作します。 その結果、企業は複雑化するサブスクリプションビジネスにおいて、手動対応を最小限に抑えつつ、収益最大化とキャッシュフローの迅速化を同時に実現することが可能になります。

現在でも、SAPのQuote-to-Cashソリューションを基盤に、企業はシームレスなオーダー登録、複雑な契約処理、正確な請求・未収金管理を実現しています。 さらにAIエージェントを組み合わせることで、たとえば分析エージェントが市場動向や顧客の利用傾向、パートナー条件などをリアルタイムで分析した上で、価格設定エージェントが、オファー内容や価格を自動調整することが可能になります。 これにより、システムが自らビジネスパラメータを最適化し、「自律的に収益を最適化するサブスクリプション管理」が現実のものとなるのです。

3. まとめ
サブスクリプション成長を加速するSAPのコミットメント サブスクリプションビジネスへの転換は、顧客生涯価値（LTV）の向上や収益の安定化など、企業に新たな成長機会をもたらします。 その一方で、複雑な価格設定、契約管理、請求・入金処理など、従来の仕組みでは対応しきれない課題も生まれています。
SAPは、アプリケーション・データ・AIを統合したエンドツーエンドのビジネス管理基盤を提供することで、こうした課題に包括的に対応します。

  • 高い機能性： サブスクリプション管理に必要な全機能を網羅
  • 優れたユーザー体験： AIエージェントがルーティン業務を代行し、スピーディかつ高品質な業務遂行を実現
  • コスト削減と収益最大化： 業務効率化と最適化によってビジネス価値を継続的に拡大

SAPのQ2Cソリューションは、AIエージェントとSAP Business Data Cloudという強固な基盤のもと、進化を続けています。 今こそ、この先進的なソリューションを活用し、サブスクリプションビジネスのさらなる成長を実現していきましょう。

entry.title: Prepare for 2602: Service Key and Service Binding Requests will change to asynchronous processing
entry.content:
Service Key and Service Binding Requests will change to asynchronous processing

Starting with release 2602, the service broker for the SAP BTP ABAP Environment will switch to asynchronous processing for service binding and service key creation requests. This change will impact client applications using interfaces like the CF CLI and CAPI.

Users of these tools/APIs need to modify their programs or scripts to prepare for this change!

Affected Interfaces

  • Cloud Foundry Command Line Interface (CF CLI)
  • Cloud Foundry Application Programming Interface (CAPI)

Read this document, if you use these calls

  • cf create-service-key
  • cf delete-service-key
  • cf bind-service
  • cf unbind-service
  • /v3/service_credential_bindings/<service binding guid> Endpoint (CF Service Credential Binding API)

Background Information

The SAP BTP ABAP Environment service broker implements the Open Service Broker API. All service offerings of this service allow to create and delete service bindings or service keys for existing SAP BTP ABAP Environment service instances. The service bindings / keys currently supported are:

  • Service Keys of the type oAuth for authentication on the ABAP System (e.g. when using the ABAP development tools)
  • Service Keys of the type basic auth for creating Communication Arrangements 
  • Service Bindings for the Integration with the Approuter

If the service broker receives a request to create (or delete) a service key or binding, it can fulfill this request synchronously or asynchronously. The Open Service Broker API allows the service broker to define the default behavior.

Up to now, these requests were processed synchronously per default.

Over time, it turned out that there are a number of situations where tasks couldn't finish within the synchronous processing timeout. Therefore we decided to change the future default to asynchronous.

Changing the default means, that client implementations need to be adapted before Release 2602: Make sure that you at least use version 8 of the cf cli or version 3 of the CF API to support asynchronous responses and that your implementation retrieves the error information as described below in detail.

Behavior up to Release 2602

Service binding create or delete requests are been processed synchronously.

  • If the call returns successfully, it means the operation was performed successfully.
  • If the call returns a failure, the error contains detailed information about what happened.

Behavior starting from Release 2602

Service binding create or delete requests are been processed asynchronously.

  • If the call returns successfully, it means the request has been successfully planned for execution in background.
  • If the call returns a failure, it means that the request could not be planned for execution.

General adaptation pattern

Make sure your code can work with the asynchronous execution of service binding create/delete operations.

Functionality that can help:

  • You can use the "wait" functionality to instruct the call to block until the the operation has been finished. (only cf cli).
  • You can read the state of the service binding for information about the processing progress and error details.

All our affected services have set the "bindings_retrievable" attribute to "true", which allows the retrieval of the state information.

Do not rely on return values and error messages of the request call. Instead query the state information either in a loop, or after the request call with "wait".

Specific adaptation recommendations per Interface

This chapter outlines only the relevant parts. Necessary, but unaffected parts (request handling, authorization handling etc.) have been left out.

Implementation recommendation (Cloud Foundry CLI)

For a detailed documentation of the Cloud Foundry CLI, see https://cli.cloudfoundry.org/en-US/v8/

Prerequisite: You should use cf cli version >= 8 (https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/cf-cli/v8.html ), which provides the "--wait" option to service binding operations.

Note: cf cli version >= 8 also results in the automatically inclusion of the query parameter "accepts_incomplete=true" in modifying requests to the service broker.

Use the "--wait" option in any of your modifying operations.

For example:

cf create-service-key <<service instance name>> <<service binding name>> -c <<parameters json object>> --wait
cf delete-service-key <<service instance name>> <<service binding name>> --wait

If you need the detailed error information in case of FAILED operations, do not rely on the cli return value.

Determine the service binding guid:

cf service-key <<service instance name>> <<service binding name>> --guid


Use the service binding guid to read the service binding details:

cf curl /v3/service_credential_bindings/<<service binding guid>>

The result data (in json format) should contain the property "last_operation" with a value being another object in json format

  • in case of a FAILED response on the service binding request
    • the property "state" of the object "last_operation" should be "failed"
    • the property "description" of the object "last_operation" should always contain a more detailed error message raised by the service broker.
  • in case of a OK response the service binding creation request
    • the property "state" of the object "last_operation" should be "succeeded"
    • evaluate the detailed data of the service binding for more information

Consequences for not following the recommendation (Cloud Foundry CLI)

  • Wrong assumption on "OK":
    The CLI call will immediately return "OK". However, this will no longer mean the request has been processed. It now means the request has been accepted and will be processed (in background). From there on, your client implementation may continue with the false assumption of success. The request is not yet finished and can still fail.
  • Wrong assumption on "FAILED":
    The response of the cli may not contain a detailed error message. It will return information about the process scheduler, but not the process itself.

Note: The "--wait" parameter can make the request call block until the process is finished, but it does not change the meaning of the "OK" or "FAILED" error messages.

Implementation recommendation (Cloud Foundry API)

For a detailed documentation of the CAPI, please see https://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.194.0/index.html#service-credential-binding

The request examples used in this chapter are based on curl syntax and they do not contain all necessary parameters/options for a successful https request (the examples also only refer to service bindings of binding type "key" and parameter type "basic").

Prerequisite: You should use a CAPI version >= 3.

Note: CAPI version >= 3 also leads to the automatic inclusion of the query parameter "accepts_incomplete=true" in modifying requests to the service broker.

If you create / delete service bindings with requests like these:

curl <<server part of url>>/v3/service_credential_bindings -X POST -H "Content-type: application/json" -d '{"type":"key","name":"<<service binding name>>","relationships":{"service_instance":{"data":{"guid":"<<service instance guid>>"}}},"parameters":{"type
":"basic","scenario_id":"<<specific scenario id>>"}}'
curl <<server part of url>>/v3/service_credential_bindings/<<service binding guid>> -X DELETE -H "Content-type: application/json"

The server will respond with:

  • HTTP Status Code 202 (Accepted)
    which means the service binding change request has been successfully created
  • a "Location" header which contains a url (including the id) to read data from the scheduled request operation from the service broker
  • In the error case: a response object (in json format) which contains the property "errors" which may contain multiple error messages

In order to correctly read the status of your request, evaluate the job data:

  • Determine the job guid by evaluating the url contained in the "Location" header or use the url directly
  • Use the job guid to recursively read the job data until you find a final state (include a meaningful waiting time)
    Example Request:
cf curl /v3/jobs/<<job guid>> -H "Content-type: application/json"​


Then evaluate the property "state" in the object of the json format response:

  • in case the property "state" has the value "PROCESSING" or "POLLING"
    • continue the polling with another read of the job data
  • in case the property "state" has the value "COMPLETE"
    • stop the polling and continue by reading the data for the service binding, if wanted
  • in case the property "state" has the value "FAILED"
    • Do not rely on the objects in the property "errors" in the response object. These won't contain the full error information about the request after 2602.

We recommend to handle the "FAILED" state in the following way:
Read the data for the service binding to ensure a detailed error message for the creation (or deletion).

  • Determine the service binding guid from the job data by evaluating the url contained in the property "service_credential_binding" or use the url directly
  • Use the service binding guid to read the service binding details
    Example request:
curl /v3/service_credential_bindings/<<service binding guid>> -H "Content-type: application/json"​
  • the response data (in json format) should contain the property "last_operation" with a value being another object in json format
    • the property "state" of the object "last_operation" should be "failed"
    • the property "description" of the object "last_operation" should always contain a more detailed error message raised by the service broker.

In case of non FAILED states, the response contains:

  • the property "state" of the object "last_operation" should be "succeeded"
  • evaluate the detailed data of the service binding, if wanted

Consequences for not following the recommendation (Cloud Foundry API)

In modifying requests (POST or DELETE), the server responds with an “OK” (HTTP status code 202 - Accepted) when the respective custom resource (AbapServiceBinding) could be created (or deletion triggered) in the underlying kubernetes cluster. This does not reflect the true state (succeeded, failed, processing) of the service binding. If you do not follow our recommendation to implement a polling mechanism, your implementation would assume, the service binding was successful, when it actually still in progress, or even failed.

We hope this blog post explains the change well and gives enough examples for you to adapt your code.

entry.title: Re: Invoice Print Type - IDOC vs Form (Fragmented Forms)
entry.content:
Yes, the “Z-Fields in Pricing Procedure” refer to custom fields added to the pricing communication structure—typically KOMK (header) or KOMP (item)—not directly to table KOMV. These fields are then used in routines to drive logic for form and IDOC separation. Take into consideration, do not enhance KOMV directly—it’s a result table and not intended for custom fields.

To separate pricing logic for Adobe Forms vs. IDOC (INVOIC02), especially across countries, you can introduce custom Z-fields that act as flags or filters. Follow the below steps to implement

Add fields like ZPRINT_FORM → controls display in Adobe Form and ZPRINT_IDOC → controls inclusion in E1EDP26 segment for KOMK & KOMP structures. Use requirement routines in V/08 (pricing procedure config) to populate the fields and to check country and condition type. Also, the logic should ensure that the condition is shown on the form but excluded from the IDOC.

In your Adobe Form (via SmartForms or Adobe LiveCycle), filter condition types using ZPRINT_FORM. This avoids relying solely on Print Type and keeps the form logic modular.

Control IDOC Output via User Exits like EXIT_SAPLVEDF_002 → for header-level filtering & EXIT_SAPLVEDF_004 → for item-level filtering

If ZPRINT_* fields are blank, fall back to standard Print Type behavior. This ensures backward compatibility and avoids breaking legacy flows.

Dear customer,

There are a few apps that may suit your needs.

1. Display G/L Account Balances: It shows cumulative balances with debit/credit details and accumulated final balances by GL account. Please choose Adapt Filters button to choose additional columns such as Fiscal Period, Fiscal Year Period. You can filter the period, compare the period balance to the previous year, and download the data in Excel format.

To access this app, kindly assign the suitable authorization: Display G/L Account Balances

To access this app, kindly assign the suitable authorization: Trial Balance

It also provides year-to-date balance analysis in an optimized grid format. Data exported in multiple formats is also supported.

To access this app, kindly assign the suitable authorization: Year-to-Date Balances

entry.title: Re: Create a Custom field in a business context and map d...
entry.content:
Hello @Gahan_Narayan1,

In addition to @junwu's comment, custom fields are usually not intended to replace standard fields or data in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud's CDS views.

Where this is applicable

Below SAP documentation confirms that the “Custom Fields & Logic” app is meant for things like:

    • Creating new fields in a business context, such as adding a “Z SpecialRating” for the Sales Order header, that are tailored to your specific business scenario. SAP Learning-Using Custom Fields and Logic
    • Enabling fields for UI, reports, templates, data sources. SAP Learning
    • Expanding a data source to include more standard fields visible/usable. SAP Learning

The primary purpose is not to map the standard field X in CDS view Y to custom field Z and just mirror it. The standard field should stay accessible; creating a custom field to duplicate it often introduces redundancy and potential risks.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to set third decimal point as Base Qua...
entry.content:
Dear @Kazuhiro_F,

Where exactly are you trying to enter 3 decimal places in the application for example CA02 (Change Routing), first screen below?

In CBC Units of measurement (102179), second screen below you can in field decimal places put your value for example 3 decimal places. Before that, did you try put value with DOT like 1.234 NOT 1,234?

 

 

You also asked about the consequences, below is the message when trying to change the decimal places field in CBC:

Changing a Unit of Measurement (UoM) may have an impact on your

applications, especially on the critical fields.

UoMs are used across applications.  An initial set of UoMs is delivered

in the system.  You can adapt your UoMs as per your requirements.  Note

that by adding, changing, or deleting the customizing, you are changing

the initial set of UoMs delivered in the system. Pay special attention

if UoMs are already saved in transactional data of productive business

processes. Changes of the fields marked as critical can result in

serious inconsistencies.

 Cross-process impacts to consider on my part:

BOMs & routings: Component quantities and base quantities can be more granular good for micro-ingredients, but expect more non-zero “residuals.”

MRP/Planning: More precise requirements, planned orders, safety stock, lot sizes. Small decimal “dust” may appear; rounders/lot-sizing may need tweaking.

Execution & backflush: Confirmations/postings may produce tiny over/under-consumptions compared to prior rounding; tolerances might need an update.

Additionally, I am attaching SAP Note:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3430205

Best Regards

Dawid

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration Suite - Basic Edition Activation
entry.content: To help you achieve dynamic mapping between any third-party app (like Shopify, Magento) and SAP Business One using SAP CPI, here’s a simple solution: Create one generic integration flow (iFlow) that reads an external JSON file containing the field mapping rules at runtime. This JSON file lets you define how source fields from any app map to SAP Business One fields, with support for simple or complex transformations. When you switch the third-party app, just update this JSON, no need to rebuild the whole integration. Use SAP Business One’s Service Layer or DI API in CPI to send data. This keeps your integration flexible, easy to maintain, and scalable without creating separate mappings for each app. If you need, start by exploring CPI’s graphical message mapping and value mapping features, which can help implement these dynamic rules smoothly.

entry.title: Sneak Peek in to SAP Analytics Cloud release for Q4 2025
entry.content:
Hard to believe we are at the final quarter of 2025 and what a year it has been. In this blog we give you a sneak peek into our Top 5 features in SAP Analytics Cloud for QRC4 2025. A full list of what is coming can be found on our Roadmap Explorer. Let's dive in!

Horizon Theme

We are excited to announce the introduction of the Horizon themes in SAP Analytics Cloud a modern, cohesive visual language aligned across SAP’s product suite. You will have access to Morning and Evening Horizon, the light and dark themes as well as to the high contrast white and black themes.

 

To learn more about this and other usability enhancement check out this great blog by @AnnaBurkhardt

 

My Metrics for KPIs Monitoring (formerly known as Watchlist)

A much anticipated new feature is the introduction of My Metrics (fka Watchlist). My Metrics to create lists of metrics that you want to monitor, analyze, and share with other stakeholders. Add to a metrics list from a chart's context menu within a story. You can gain insights of the data changes and organize important metrics associated with your business in an intuitive way. With this new feature users can enjoy:

  • New design that enables you to add and monitor your KPIs within SAP Analytics Cloud
  • Ability to create, manage, and share your Metric Lists
  • Ability for viewers to add KPIs directly from stories
  • Customized comparisons and previews

Seamless Planning

We have two exciting additions to Seamless Planning this quarter, SAP Datasphere fact view as a live version in a planning model and the ability to Scheduling a story based on a live SAP Datasphere solution connection.

Let's start with the ability to consume an existing SAP Datasphere fact view live using a separate version dimension element within a planning model:

  • Version element is available for consumption within stories (read-only in table)
  • Version element can be used as a source for planning operations, including copy and paste from an external version to a local version, or in batch operations, such as data actions, as a source or reference for copy and calculation operations

We have also added the ability to schedule and deliver a story based on a live connection of SAP Datasphere to users over e-mail through SAP Analytics Cloud.

 These are just 2 new features in the Seamless Planning story and there are many other in this great blog by @Max_Gander 

Scheduling & Process Management: Factory Calendar

Staying with planning we also introduce the ability to schedule calendar tasks and publications based on working days. This includes the ability to:

  • Define a custom property representing workdays as an attribute in a model time dimension
  • View working days within the calendar and Gantt view
  • Set task recurrence based on working days

 

 

SAP Analytics Cloud Performance Content: Model and audit table sizes

For administrators and system owners of SAP Analytics Cloud, maintaining a high-performing and stable environment is a top priority. As organizations expand their use of SAC, managing the underlying data volumes becomes increasingly important.

So in this release we are delivering a new Story in SAC Content designed to give you the transparency and control you need to manage your SAC tenant's data footprint effectively. This Story serves as a central overview for monitoring, analyzing, and then to be able to take an informed action on data volumes before they become a critical issue.

 

For further details check out this great blog by @thomas_fery 

There are plenty more exciting deliverables coming your way this quarter and we will be taking a deeper dive into these items in our What’s New video and blog series so stay tuned. For a full list of all features coming in QRC3 2025 for SAP Analytics Cloud check out the Roadmap Explorer  and the What's New Viewer

Want to experience new and existing features for yourself? Take the leap and start your journey towards making data-driven decisions with confidence by signing up for a free trial, today.

entry.title: SAP TM -- KPI area in Transportation Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA 2025 & SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
SAP TM -- KPI area in Transportation Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA 2025 & SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

The latest release of SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition 2025 introduces groundbreaking enhancements to the Transportation Cockpit, with a particular focus on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that revolutionize how transportation planners monitor and optimize their operations.

Comprehensive KPI Coverage for Road Transportation

The new KPI functionality delivers 93 standard KPIs specifically designed for road transportation, making critical performance metrics readily available across freight order lists, freight unit stages, and truck resources. This comprehensive coverage ensures that planners have access to the most relevant performance indicators for their daily operations.

The enhanced Transportation Cockpit now provides KPIs across six fundamental categories:

Examples of the KPIs in the Transportation Cockpit.

Advanced KPI Profile Configuration

The KPI display system offers extensive customization through KPI profiles, allowing organizations to tailor their dashboard according to specific business requirements. Key configuration capabilities include:

  • Flexible Sequencing: Define the precise order in which KPIs appear
  • Selective Display: Choose which KPIs are most relevant for specific operations
  • Delta Value Tracking: Monitor changes and trends over time
  • Previous Value Comparisons: Historical performance analysis
  • Threshold-Based Coloring: Visual indicators based on performance thresholds that can be updated depending on set parameters

Real-Time KPI Updates and Planning Impact

One of the most significant advantages of the new KPI system is its real-time calculation and update capability. KPIs are automatically recalculated after each planning step, enabling planners to:

  • Immediately visualize the impact of planning decisions
  • See how KPIs change in real-time during the planning process
  • Make data-driven adjustments based on live performance metrics
  • Optimize transportation plans with immediate feedback on performance changes

This improved transparency of KPIs during the planning process helps planners make better decisions, ultimately leading to improved transportation plans.

Enhanced Distance Tracking Capabilities

The system now provides more granular distance tracking with new fields for "Distance (Empty)" and "Distance (Loaded)". This enhancement applies to:

  • Road and rail freight orders
  • Container, trailer, and railcar units
  • Transportation Cockpit displays
  • Individual document user interfaces

This granular tracking gives planners enhanced transparency into whether a resource is traveling empty or loaded, helping optimize routing and minimize empty miles.

Driver-Based Grouping and Resource Management

The road freight order hierarchy now supports grouping by driver, providing planners with enhanced visibility into:

  • Driver workload distribution
  • Resource allocation efficiency
  • Operational planning optimization
  • Performance tracking by individual drivers

This feature allows planners to easily visualize the freight orders planned for specific drivers, improving resource management and operational oversight.

Environmental Impact Monitoring

The enhanced KPI system includes comprehensive CO2 consumption tracking for vehicle types and resources. This environmental monitoring covers:

  • Empty vehicle emissions
  • Partially loaded vehicle consumption
  • Fully loaded vehicle efficiency
  • Resource selection optimization for reduced emissions

Planners can now see the CO2 consumption for resources in different states (empty, partly loaded, or fully loaded), helping them choose the most efficient resource for manual planning and reduce overall CO2 emissions.

To show the KPIs in the Transportation Cockpit you need to indicate the KPI Profile in the Profile and Layout Set Management for Transportation Cockpit

Or individual in Transportation Cockpit: Profile and Layout Sets

Check out in this link bellow how to setup the customizing and profiles to make this KPI available to the Key users in the Transportation Cockpit:

https://support.sap.com/content/dam/productfeatures/assets/00053/000D3ABE772D1FD08DC43FD7FF64773C/presentations/2025_06_05_FP0_TransportationCockpit.pdf

Support Documentation:

Enhancements for Manual Planning and Transportation Cockpit | SAP Help Portal

Key Performance Indicators in the Transportation Cockpit | SAP Help Portal

Hope this help you!

Thank you and regards.

Rogerio Lima.

entry.title: Re: purchasing view data master data
entry.content:
Hello  

Hi Fernanda, here are reliable, official links and a quick guide to build the comparison report in S/4HANA Public Cloud

How to build it (quick path)

Find the data sources (released CDS views) with View Browser (F2170). Look up views like:

  • I_ProductProcurement (purchasing-view attributes)
  • I_ProductPlant (plant-specific product settings)

Create the report using Custom Analytical Queries: select fields like Material, Plant, Purchasing Organisation, Purchasing Group, Order Unit, Planned Delivery Time, and Automatic Purchase Order. Filter for plants linked to your two company codes, execute, and export results. SAP Help Portal-Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition-Custom Analytical Queries

Optional: Consume the query in SAC if you want richer diffing and visualsSAP Support Portal-2710858 - Custom Analytical Queries created in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are not visible in SAP Analytics Cloud

Below are useful SAP Direct links

  • Custom Analytical Queries (app help) – how to design and run your own query. SAP Help Portal & How to use Custom Analytical Queries in SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics?
  • View Browser (F2170) – Fiori Apps Library – find released CDS views and inspect fields.
  • CDS: Product Procurement (I_ProductProcurement) – purchasing-relevant fields by product. SAP Help Portal-Virtual Data Model and CDS Views-Product Procurement
  • CDS: Product Master / I_ProductPlant – plant-level product attributes. SAP Help Portal-Virtual Data Model and CDS Views-CDS Views for Product Master
  • If vendor-specific needed Purchasing Info Record docs / CDS – background on PIR data and the released CDS. SAP Help Portal-Virtual Data Model and CDS Views-Purchasing Info Record

With kind regards

entry.title: Re: Success factor beginning
entry.content:
Hi Ernesto, 

Do you have access to the SAP Learning Hub? If not , I would recommend getting a license for this, as it is where all of the online and classroom learning can be found. There are different versions of the learning hub depending on whether you are a student/ customer or partner. So I recommend checking with your company first if they have these licenses and if not looking at the version that fits best. 

Once you have access there are different courses for each of the SuccessFactors Modules - (for example Employee Central, Recruiting etc.) so which one to complete depends on the module that you want/ need to learn about. 

But you said you wanted a starter overview, so I would recommend this course which gives an overall overview accross the entire solution and is tailored for beginners. 
https://learning.sap.com/courses/hire-to-retire-strategy-implementation-and-operations

Best of luck with your learning journey. 
Paul

entry.title: Re: How can we pull all records daily by using Dataflows
entry.content: Hi Oleh_Ilchyshyn1! I've tried this approach - it works but there is one problem I can't get around - as stated accounts.search endpoint has 10000 limit - and since Dataflows are not really flexible, I can't take advantage of openCursor and cursorId that search endpoint offers in order to extract all of the customers.

entry.title: Shaping the Future of SAP Cloud ALM: Join My Sessions at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
At SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin, I’m excited to lead two sessions that dive deep into how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into an intelligent, autonomous platform that redefines how organizations manage their SAP landscapes. 

If you’re guiding your company’s cloud transformation or planning your move from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, these sessions are for you. 

Before I share what I'm going to present about in SAP TechEd Berlin, I would like to share with you some background information. 

 

SAP’s ALM strategy and vision 

Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) is the backbone of enterprise IT, orchestrating the full lifecycle of applications - from design and build, through migration and service delivery, to ongoing operations. 

SAP’s vision is to evolve SAP Cloud ALM into a transformation execution platform, supporting the full lifecycle: Scope, Build, Migrate, and Run.  

With the new “Scope” pillar, SAP Cloud ALM will become the central scoping hub by integrating results from the Digital Discovery Assessment (to speed up projects by re-using assessment data), the SAP Readiness Check (to include simplification items), Best Practice Guidance coming from SAP Signavio and information from the Landscape Discovery. 

In “Build”, we plan to strengthen the integration between SAP Signavio and SAP Cloud ALM, and further enrich the existing capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for process and project management, testing, and deployment management. 

With the also new “Migrate” pillar, we combine and enhance offerings to support customers with data migration for their cloud transformation projects, as well as integrating Custom Code Management capabilities and adding rollout and template management to support large-scale enterprise transformations. 

For the “Run” pillar, SAP plans to move towards autonomous ALM in three steps - from leveraging AI in Integration Monitoring, Health Monitoring, and Business Process Monitoring, through agentic AI use cases to fully autonomous ALM for implementation, powered by embedded AI and Joule agents. 

 

What will I cover at SAP TechEd 2025? 

At SAP TechEd, I am going to cover two different aspects of our ALM strategy: First, I will dive into our plans on leveraging AI in SAP Cloud ALM, and second I will lay out the roadmap of SAP Cloud ALM from an innovation persopective. 

 

Session 1: Strategy for SAP Cloud ALM with Autonomous ALM and Joule 

Session ID: ST106 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 10:15am 

How can artificial intelligence revolutionize the way we manage SAP landscapes? In this strategy session, we’ll explore SAP’s vision for autonomous ALM using SAP Cloud ALM — powered by Joule, SAP’s generative AI copilot. 

You’ll learn how AI agents can proactively identify and resolve operational issues, reducing manual intervention and ensuring continuous, automated system reliability. We’ll also discuss SAP’s roadmap toward a fully autonomous ALM future — where human oversight shifts from problem-solving to strategic innovation. 

 

 

Session 2: Road Map for SAP Cloud ALM 

Session ID: CS805 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 11:45am 

In this deep-dive session, we’ll walk through the latest innovations and upcoming features of SAP Cloud ALM. Expect insights on autonomous capabilities, integrated tool chains, and the role of the Joule copilot in simplifying daily operations. 

We’ll also discuss the SAP Readiness Check for SAP Cloud ALM, designed to help customers plan and execute their transition from SAP Solution Manager with confidence. Whether you’re just getting started with Cloud ALM or looking to optimize existing operations, this session will provide practical guidance for your next steps. 

 

 

Why You Should Attend 

Both sessions are designed to help you understand what’s next for SAP Cloud ALM, but how you can get there. Join me in Berlin to explore how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into a transformation execution platform powered by broad integrations and meaningful AI - and how your organization can benefit from it today. 

 

Now let’s hear from you: 

What are your most favorite features in SAP Cloud ALM? Let me know in the comments! 

 

#SAP #ALM #CloudALM #Strategy #Roadmap #AI #AutonomousAI
